{"step_by_step_thinking": "The deciduous mandibular first molar is a tooth in the lower jaw. It has several cusps, which are the pointed parts of the tooth. The mesiolingual cusp is located on the side of the tooth closest to the midline of the mouth and on the side facing the tongue. The distolingual cusp is on the side of the tooth farthest from the midline and on the side facing the tongue. The mesiobuccal cusp is on the side of the tooth closest to the midline and on the side facing the cheek. The distobuccal cusp is on the side of the tooth farthest from the midline and on the side facing the cheek. The highest and sharpest cusp on the deciduous mandibular first molar is typically the mesiobuccal cusp.", "answer_choice": "C. Mesiobuccal"}
